holidays.name: No Socks Day
holidays.description: A quirky day dedicated to celebrating the freedom of going sockless, encouraging people to ditch their socks and let their toes breathe.
holidays.origin: Believed to have started in the early 2000s as a fun, informal way to welcome warmer weather and embrace casual comfort.
holidays.funFact: Some people use No Socks Day as an excuse to show off funky toe nail art or quirky footwear!

holidays.name: Have a Coke Day
holidays.description: A fizzy celebration paying homage to the iconic soft drink Coca-Cola, inviting fans to crack open a cold Coke and savor the classic taste.
holidays.origin: This unofficial holiday sprung from the global fanbase of Coca-Cola and its cultural significance since 1886.
holidays.funFact: May 8th was reportedly the day in 1985 when Coca-Cola introduced the New Coke formula, making this soda day ironically fitting!

holidays.name: World Red Cross and Red Crescent Day
holidays.description: A solemn day honoring the humanitarian efforts of the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement worldwide.
holidays.origin: Established to commemorate the birthday of Henry Dunant, the founder of the Red Cross, born May 8, 1828.
holidays.funFact: The Red Cross emblem was inspired by the Swiss flag with its colors inverted, symbolizing neutrality and protection.

holidays.name: No Fair Day
holidays.description: A tongue-in-cheek observance inviting people to protest unfairness, whether in games, life's little annoyances, or just to vent!
holidays.origin: An unofficial, humorous day that encourages expressing frustrations with unfair situations.
holidays.funFact: No Fair Day is often used by parents and kids alike as a lighthearted excuse when things don't go their way.
